topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55b43de26368725cb70008c1#post_55b43de26368725cb70008c1
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55b4408163687215160005a8#post_55b4408163687215160005a8
This might interest you guys but apparently China is starting to slowly lift bans on video games in China and consoles in China.

Up until this point in order for games to be sold legally they would have to go through a bunch of bureaucrats beforehand.

The reason why this is good is A)china's bootleg game market got so huge because the majority of their people couldn't play games legitimately B)we probably will see the video game industry potentially double over the next decade C)it would push a bunch of the "games" that are really just illegally taking existing games and redistributing them under a unrelated company's name out of business.

To put it another way the reason why there's so many problems with companies over in china ripping apart games and creating bootleg versions is that up until this point for the most part you had to go through the chinese government.
